name: Piglet
description:
Piglet is a sweet, affectionate little girl. She loves to follow you around and get lots of love! Born approx 7/17 she was rescued from the Cleburne Shelter.

Adoption fee is $100 and includes vaccinations received, de-worming, rabies shot, FIV/FeLV test and spay/neuter.
If you are interested please contact Alice at possum2003@gmail.com - online application will need to be completed at www.shelter2rescue.org (scroll down for cat application)

name: Gemma
description:
Gemma a bigger corso that needs a owner that knows the breed. She came into rescue with her mate who also will be up for adoption. She needs structure and rules. Gemma is very sweet and loving and playful.
Kids that are older only she is a bigger girl that can be mouthy at times when playing.
www.azmastiffrescue.com

name: Bobby
description:
Bobby is a sweet and friendly older beagle gentleman of 11 years old. If Bobby could talk he would have quite the story to tell. He belonged to a family about 8 years ago in Orlando, they later gave him to a friend who also lived in Orlando. Somehow he recently wound up in Baker County Animal Control. While at animal control he was scanned for a microchip and one was found, however the 2 numbers on the registration were no longer good and so BCAC contacted us to take him. We contacted the chip company and got the 2 numbers and the registered owner's name. Through some tracing we were able to make contact. Unfortunately they were not in a place to be able to take him but they had always wondered what happened to him. We assured him he was safe and that we would find him a great home. Are you that home??

Bobby gets along with other dogs, cats and children are an unknown. He is current on vaccinations, neutered, microchipped and tested heartworm negative! His adoption fee is just $200, and he is fostered in Baker County. To set up a meet and cuddle with the traveling man, just email us! Home visit and reference checks are required and not negotiable.

name: Like Momma
description:
Born to a young mother who was rescued from the streets, Like Momma has tons of energy and is always ready to play!! But he's also very affectionate! Won't you give him a home and some love?    

Email AnimalRescueCarolina@yahoo.com to find out more about Like Momma or visit our adoption event at the Harbison PetSmart every Saturday from 12pm – 4 pm.

name: Ben/CP
description:
Ben's owner's health issues make it necessary to surrender him.  Ben know the stay and sit commands very well.    He loves treats but won't eat them anywhere but in his crate.  He plays well with his brother, a great pyranees mix.  
Ben spends nice days outside off and on, and sleeps in his crate.  He enjoys watching TV in his owner's lap.  He likes to have his nails trimmed!
 
Please complete our application at:

http://www.russellrescuetn.com/application-for-adoption/

name: Ms Daisy
breed: Australian Cattle Dog/Blue Heeler / Bulldog / Mixed (medium coat)
description:
Sweet Ms Daisy is a playful girl who is good with other dogs and her foster family. She is a smart pup, and is eager to learn new things. Ms Daisy is very active, and would love to have a family who spends time playing with her. She would do best with a fenced yard to play in and a doggie playmate, and is a lovable puppy who will make a great addition to your family    She loves kids!   If you are interested in adopting Ms Daisy, please fill out this form http://anewleash.org/animals/dog-adoption-form/

Come meet our dogs and cats at 5 locations:

A New Leash Lodge (Adoption Center)

Open Thursdays and Fridays 12-7pm

**This pet's adoption fee is a tax-deductible donation to help pay part of his/her vet bills.

ALL PETS FULLY VETTED BEFORE ADOPTION: including exam, MICROCHIP, spay/neuter, HW test, fecal, deworm, DA2PPv, Rabies (if old enough), as well as any other medications or surgeries the pet needs.

There is an additional $25 fee for out of town adoptions.

Some highly adoptable dogs who will find a forever home quickly, have a higher adoption fee. These dogs leave a financial legacy for the other animals in our care who may need extensive medical care or more time to find a loving home.

Return Policy: Foster homes save many lives, and as soon as one gets adopted, they often get another one.  So spaces fill up fast!  If you wish to return your adopted dog, please email pets@anewleash.org and be prepared to bring him/her to adoption events until a forever home is found.  In some cases their previous foster can take them back. They cannot be given away, sold, or turned in to another agency. You are responsible for keeping the dog and bringing him/her to adoption events until we find a suitable home to adopt them.

Please visit our website at www.anewleash.org for more information.

By clicking on this link http://anewleash.org/donate/

name: Rowdy II
description:
Rowdy is a fun, goofy & lovable, 70 pound Pointer Lab mix who is almost 3 years old (born Nov. 2014). He is well past the puppy phase and is fully potty trained, doesn't chew on the furniture or scratch up the doors/walls. He is also fully crate trained, but once he is used to his surroundings, he can roam the house freely while you are gone and he won't leave any messes!

Rowdy absolutely LOVES being able to look out the window while his humans are gone- there are so many birds and cars and squirrels to watch!! He adores his humans (all people, actually) and warms up to strangers very quickly. His favorite things include belly scratches, his ball, anyone throwing a toy for him to fetch, taking naps on the couch, treats or peanut butter in his Kong toy, sneaking into his humans' bed in the middle of the night, practicing his tricks (he knows sit, stay, down, high five and spin), and giving lots and lots kisses. Rowdy is very smart and is super quick to pick up on routine. As soon as you put on your shoes, he will run to his crate and wait for a treat! He loves to have "bed time" with his humans where he gets to cuddle in his parents' bed, but he also knows the command "go night night" and he will go straight to his bed! Due to his larger size, we might recommend no small children - Rowdy still thinks he is a puppy and doesn't understand how much he weighs! He will also need to be the only dog in the home.

If you feel your home might be the right place for such a great dog - the place to start is with the adoption application found at www.dfwrescueme.org/adopt. Once submitted, the foster will contact you promptly to tell you more and to arrange a time to meet!

The adoption fee for all of our dogs is $250.00, which includes their vaccinations and spay/neuter.

Rowdy is participating in the DFW Rescue Me Guest Dog Program, so ongoing care and custody are provided by their foster, not by DFWRM.

name: Blacky
description:
Thank you for considering adopting one of CARA's Special pets! To apply read about our adoption policies here to fill out an application.


My name is Blacky, I'm a beautiful black cat. I am a year and a half old and love to play. I have lots of personality and energy. Come and meet me here at CARA, maybe you could e my furever home.


To see more animals for adoption, please visit the CARA Website

Our adoption fees are:
Dogs: $155
Cats: $95
Puppies under 4 months: $115 plus S/N Deposit: $100
Kittens under 4 months: $70 plus S/N Deposit: $100

All pets available for adoption have been spayed or neutered (unless under 4 months please read about our adoptions here ), are current on vaccinations and preventatives, and micro-chipped. Cats have been tested and confirmed negative for Feline AIDS and Leukemia. Dogs have been tested for heartworm disease.

Our shelter is located at 42 Deep River Rd in Sanford and is open Tues, Thurs,  & Fri from 3pm - 7pm & Sat from 10-2pm (other times available by appointment). CARA's adoption process and online application can be found at  http://www.cara-nc.org/info/adoption

Please call 919-774-9433, email adoptions@cara-nc.org, or visit www.cara-nc.org for information about this or other pets available for adoption.

If you would like to adopt me or any of my friends, please visit CARA to fill out an on-line application or e-mail us at adoptions@cara-nc.org.

Every animal that comes into the CARA program is here because one or more events occurred  that led to this animal needing not only a home, but a person or family to love and protect them. Each animal has been loved and cared for by a small and determined group of people who want nothing more than to know each animal is safe for the rest of his or her life. Thank you for looking to adopt!

name: Lilly
*NickNack Bond
summary: 9 yr old, 10 lb Yorkie and Poodle Mix NEUTERED MALE for ADOPTION
breed: Yorkshire Terrier Yorkie / Poodle (Miniature) / Mixed (medium coat)
description:
Umbrella of Hope "Be Our Pet"


9 yr old, 10 lb Yorkie and Poodle Mix NEUTERED MALE for ADOPTION

 

Meet Mr NickNack Bond -- SF Bay Area of CA
 
NickNack is a 9 yr old, 10 lb Yorkie and Poodle Mix NEUTERED MALE who came to us from San Jose Animal Care Center via San Jose Animal Advocates and Tails of a Shelter Vet
d
NIckNack has also been microchipped, vaccinated and had senior labwork.
 
NickNack arrived at the shelter in the shape shown below -- matted, missing hair, covered in fleas and with long fingernails. He has since been groomed and will take glamour shots at our adoption event this weekend with our volunteer photography team.
 
Please do not judge a dog by the neglect of a former owner. NickNack is a great guy who is happy and loving. He is now clean and being treated for the skin and ear infections he had related to the flea infestation and neglect and he feels SO much better. He will be continuing treatment for the next 3-4 weeks and after that will have no ongoing medication.  UPDATE 12/21/17 -- he has recovered from his skin and ear infections
 
Our vet has placed him on FirstMate Pet Foods Senior variety (dry) food as it is grain free (skin friendly) and easy on his senior system. It can be purchased locally from Pet Food Express or ordered online at Chewy.com
 
NIckNack gets along with other dogs and with all people. He did not bother the cats at our vet clinic and is doing well with the ones in his foster home. He seems to be housebroken. He is crate trained and leash trained. As a non-shedding dog, he will need to be professionally groomed every 4-6 weeks to prevent him from ever looking like a swamp monster again.
 
He does like to "talk" a lot... so apartment life may not be the best for him.  
 
He qualifies for our Seniors for Seniors program where all dogs aged 5+ can be adopted to people 55+ for $5. Adoptions to US Military Veterans are always free. All regular adoption criteria apply and application required.
 
We adopt to anyone willing to come to us to meet him. We are not the Amazon Prime of animal rescue and do not drop ship live animals to your door without any effort on your part to participate in the process.
 
To inquire about adoption, please email beourpet@gmail.com
 
To make a tax-deductible donation towards the care of NickNack and to allow us to save more senior dogs like him, please do so online at www.paypal.me/UOH
 
#startastoryadopt
#shelterpetlove

GENERAL INFO:  

Housebroken?: Yes, we think so -- learning curve expected

Crate Trained?: Yes

Leash Trained?: Yes

Rides Well in Car?: Yes

Non-Shedding?: Yes -- will require regular professional grooming every 4-6 weeks

Good with cats?: Yes, we think so

Good with dogs?: Yes

Qualifies for Seniors for Seniors?: yes

Umbrella of Hope does not have any strict rules on ages of children because all children are different, but our best approximation is that this animal would do best with children over the age of 5

Umbrella of Hope is a non-profit animal rescue based out of Pittsburg, CA that rescues animals off death row from local shelters. We offer rebates of adoption fees after completion of obedience classes and CGC titles. 

Also, ask us about our seniors for seniors program, where we adopt animals 5 years or older to qualified homes with a $5 donation as an adoption fee. All animals are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, treated for parasites and given any additional treatments (dental work, bloodwork etc) as recommended by our vet. Some of our senior animals have sponsorships for their food/vet care/medicine for the rest of their life at our vet in Pittsburg, CA (94565)

 Adoptions to veterans of the US Armed Services are ALWAYS free to thank you for your service.  Other retired public servants, please let us know what career you retired from and we can let you know if we offer any discounts for your adoption

Please send an email to the Umbrella Of Hope Animal Director with any inquiries at beourpet@gmail.com. Detailed emails will be answered first.  

We thank Maddie's Fund for their sponsorship, Well Pet Vet Clinic for providing most of our veterinary services, Lovely Grooming for our grooming needs, and Delta Dog Camp for training. We thank Memoirs of a Dog and Share the Joy Photography for the beautiful portraits of many of our animals and a special thanks to volunteer photographers Barbara, Kristy, Christine and Natalie.  Please support these businesses for supporting rescue!

We offer rebates after completion of obedience classes and CGC titles.  Also, ask us about our seniors for seniors program, where we adopt animals 5 years or older to qualified homes with a $5 donation as an adoption fee. Please send an email to the Umbrella Of Hope Animal Director at beourpet@gmail.com with any inquiries. Detailed emails will be answered first.

name: Minnie
description:
Thank you for considering adopting one of CARA's Special pets! To apply read about our adoption policies here to fill out an application.


My name is Minnie and I came to CARA because my mom and dad got a divorce. My mom took the dog and I went with my dad. However, my dad went off to fight in Afghanistan. The nice people at CARA graciously took me in, but I was so scared and confused that I wasn’t eating or using the litter box. So these nice board members took me to their home and gave me my own bedroom until I am comfortable in my temporary surroundings. There are several dogs and cats at my foster home, which is scary, but I am eating, sleeping on the bed and using the litter box. My foster moms come in frequently to spend time with me. I am starting to feel
comfortable with them so I come out from hiding for some much needed love and affection.
Boy do I like to be pet, especially my belly. My purr has a wonderful melody. If you are looking
for an only cat that will love you, keep your lap warm in the winter and be thankful for a fur-
ever home, please consider me. Oh, I almost forgot. I am declawed, which I know will be
extremely inviting to some people out there.


To see more animals for adoption, please visit the CARA Website

Our adoption fees are:
Dogs: $155
Cats: $95
Puppies under 4 months: $115 plus S/N Deposit: $100
Kittens under 4 months: $70 plus S/N Deposit: $100

All pets available for adoption have been spayed or neutered (unless under 4 months please read about our adoptions here ), are current on vaccinations and preventatives, and micro-chipped. Cats have been tested and confirmed negative for Feline AIDS and Leukemia. Dogs have been tested for heartworm disease.

Our shelter is located at 42 Deep River Rd in Sanford and is open Tues, Thurs,  & Fri from 3pm - 7pm & Sat from 10-2pm (other times available by appointment). CARA's adoption process and online application can be found at  http://www.cara-nc.org/info/adoption

Please call 919-774-9433, email adoptions@cara-nc.org, or visit www.cara-nc.org for information about this or other pets available for adoption.

If you would like to adopt me or any of my friends, please visit CARA to fill out an on-line application or e-mail us at adoptions@cara-nc.org.

Every animal that comes into the CARA program is here because one or more events occurred  that led to this animal needing not only a home, but a person or family to love and protect them. Each animal has been loved and cared for by a small and determined group of people who want nothing more than to know each animal is safe for the rest of his or her life. Thank you for looking to adopt!
descriptionPlain:
Thank you for considering adopting one of CARA's Special pets! To apply read about our adoption policies  here  to fill out an application.


My name is Minnie and I came to CARA because my mom and dad got a divorce. My mom took the dog and I went with my dad. However, my dad went off to fight in Afghanistan. The nice people at CARA graciously took me in, but I was so scared and confused that I wasn’t eating or using the litter box. So these nice board members took me to their home and gave me my own bedroom until I am comfortable in my temporary surroundings. There are several dogs and cats at my foster home, which is scary, but I am eating, sleeping on the bed and using the litter box. My foster moms come in frequently to spend time with me. I am starting to feel
 comfortable with them so I come out from hiding for some much needed love and affection.
 Boy do I like to be pet, especially my belly. My purr has a wonderful melody. If you are looking
 for an only cat that will love you, keep your lap warm in the winter and be thankful for a fur-
 ever home, please consider me. Oh, I almost forgot. I am declawed, which I know will be
 extremely inviting to some people out there.

name: Annapurna
description:
Annapurna is a beautiful young cat. She was very shy when she came in to the shelter but once she grew to trust her foster mom she became the most playful and lovable cat. She loves belly rubs and chasing toys, especially "Da Bird."She is still shy in her foster home when it's busy, so she'll do best in a quiet home.  She will make a very sweet companion for a patient adopter who is willing to gain her trust. She was found outside with her four kittens Kavi, Ravi, Dev and Dinesh.

f you'd like to meet this cat or think this cat would be a good match for your family, please complete our adoption questionnaire at http://www.trentoncats.org/adoption-questionnaire/ and let your references know someone will be in touch with them shortly.

All our cats are neutered, up to date on age-appropriate vaccinations, dewormed and flea-treated, tested for FIV/FeLV, and microchipped prior to adoption. NOTE: Our cats are either in foster homes or retail adoption centers. If you are interested in meeting a specific kitty, please email us.

name: KENYA
Cookies and Cream, what a great kitten combination
description:
Cookies and Cream (aka Black Nose/White Nose) are a pair of whimsical kittens who put the joy in being a pet parent.

Cookies (Black Nose) is a lively, spirited kitten who steals your heart and the spotlight. She is a constant source of entertainment. Her enthusiasm shines through in all that she does; when she eats she ends up with food all over her nose and face, and she cocks her head in the most adorable way, a gesture that reveals the white spots around her mouth.  She is also quite the inquisitive problem solver, climbing up your leg to settle right onto your lap as if that’s where she rightfully belongs. Cookies has a serious FOMO (fear of missing out)! She has an active soul, always in search of food, chase, play, and attention.

 Cream (White Nose) is quite the opposite. She is a mature and independent kitty but never shies away when it comes to love and praise. Prim and proper, she keeps herself very clean and has mastered the art of grooming.  Her adorable face with its white nose and mouth are always fluffed to perfection without blunder.  Cream is very gentle when being handled. She can be lively and playful just like her sis, and loves to chase and run around with soft, colorful balls!

Cookies and Cream were taken in off the streets of Brooklyn where they had been abandoned by their mother. These smart kittens knew how to get noticed and walked straight up to their rescuer. Now they're just looking for a place to call their very own!

The pair has tested negative for FIV/FeLV and are vaccinated. They're a bonded pair and need to be adopted together. Contact us today at belinda@brooklynanimalaction.org if you might want to give this playful pair a furrrever home.

Thank you for thinking of a rescue animal in need of a loving home! Adopting one animal will help to open space for future furry-friends dreaming of forever homes!

All Brooklyn Animal Action cats and dogs are available to adopt, foster and foster-to-adopt.

BrooklynAnimalAction.org

name: ZZ-Simba *courtesy post
description:
Meet SIMBA! *courtesy post - contact Kimberly at 714-206-7343 for adoption information!

This very handsome boy is SIMBA! He's a 1 yr. old German Shepherd mix weighing in at 72lbs. He is neutered and up to date on all shots. Simba is a high energy boy who loves walks and getting lots of exercise. He does well with other large dogs and kids and he's friendly with people after getting a chance to sniff and meet them. Simba does need a slow introduction to smaller dogs though and it's not known how is with cats so we would say no for now. He is a major cuddle bug...but loves his squeaky toys/balls! Simba doesn't have much time to find a forever home so please call as soon as possible to meet him!

Contact Kimberly at 714-206-7343 or via email at menen101@mail.chapman.edu to meet Simba!

name: Blue
color: White with Tan, Yellow or Fawn
description:
Blue is super friendly and happy to be where he gets a regular meal everyday. He came in underweight as a stray and still tested neg for Lyme. He wants to be a best friend to anyone that will let him. Good with other dogs and kids. Walks on a leash better and better. Please help this wonderful boy find a home.


Rescue inquiries welcome! We work with rescues in northeastern states via the For All Paws Sake transport network.Our dogs can be transported as far as New England on Saturdays. Receiving Rescue Application:  https://form.jotform.com/43615319121144

name: Bubba
description:
Bubba is an adorable, sweet pup who gets along well with everyone including dogs and children.  He arrived at 12 weeks old with his brother Buster to the rescue and is in foster care.   Don't let their hound mix fool you, he is a pretty quiet, good-natured boy who are house trained, knows sit, is working stay, and does great with both other dogs and with kids. He will grow into large size adults and is currently 45 lbs and just under 6 months old. He loves toys and we recommend a fenced-in yard as he also loves hanging out outside with you on nice days.

Bubba is up to date on vaccinations and will be neutered before going to his forever home.  Apply today to meet this wonderful boy!  


PLEASE NOTE:   HHARG does not have a shelter or other physical location. All of our animals are cared for in foster homes. 

If you would like more information about one of the dogs or puppies on our site please email info@healingheartsrescuegroup.org

If you are interested in adopting a dog or puppy, please first review our adoption policies and procedures and fees, and then fill out our online adoption application.

name: Chance
color: White with Tan, Yellow or Fawn
description:
Hey everyone! I'm Chance and I want to be your new best friend! I can't tell you where I've been the past couple of years but I do know that I love people, other animals and being a part of a pack! I would do best in a new home that has another dog for me to pal around with.  I also will need a fenced yard as I tend to zip out the door if I can.  A fence will keep me safe.  Sometimes I get a little nervous but once I meet you and learn my surroundings, I'm nothing but puppy! Will you please give me my second chance on life and make me your new best friend? I respond well to training, love to cuddle and I am very good in the house!  Chance is being fostered in Iowa. 

 
Complete the adoption form here : ADOPT ME
 
*Please be sure to read the adoption info/FAQ tab on our main website before applying for a dog.

name: Buttercup *ADOPTION FEE WAIVED*(California)
description:
Please contact Berkeley Animal Care (animalservices@cityofberkeley.info) for more information about this pet.
 
*Provided by 
PBRC Courtesy  Dog Listings
 
**Please Note - Dogs Available Nationwide - * check (state) before applying. 
Access the adoption application included with this listing.

The easiest way to begin the communication and adoption process is by filling out an adoption application.

*****************************************

 
 

Location - CALIFORNA

Buttercup! Our sweet middle-aged gal has a zest for life and is oh so sweet! She's all about sweetness, love and snuggles! Buttercup lights up with attention from her favorite volunteers (read: all volunteers) and has a little fold of extra skin at the base of her tail that gives her extra wagging power -- when she's wagging full force, her wiggle butt propels her around the room! She is a breeze to harness up and walk and prefers to mosey along at a comfortable pace. When it’s time to return to the shelter, this smart cookie puts on the brakes, however, she is such a fun-loving gal, a little cheerleading and jogging gets her moving happily along. Come meet Buttercup today and let her wiggle her way into your heart and out of the shelter!

Listing Organization Name: Berkeley Animal Care Services

Listing Organization Website: http://friendsofbacs.org/adopt-dogs/

Listing Organization Contact Email: animalservices@cityofberkeley.info

Adoption Fee: $125.00

Online Adoption Application: http://cityofberkeley.info/City_Manager/Animal_Shelter/Adopt_A_Pet.aspx


Please consider a donation to PBRC.   Your donations make a difference to countless dogs through spay/neuter, educating the public, promoting a positive image and finding them permanent homes.  Donate : http://www.pbrc.net/donate.html

name: Hanna
description:
Hanna was in bad shape when we first rescued her but after time healing she has proven to have a spunky, sparkly personality! Despite her injuries (we don't know what happened) she is a friendly LOVELY girl who wants companionship and a home. She has healed nicely and her hair is growing back quickly. Hanna is bubbly and a young girl with a very playful personality, she would need to be the only dog in a home. She loves affection and is very well-mannered. She brings so much joy to everyone! Meet this little angel Hanna at the Akita Ranch!

#AkitaRanch 28930 Ellis Ave, Romoland, CA, open 10-5 daily. Email apassionforpaws@gmail.com for adoption information.

 


Follow us on Instagram @ http://instagram.com/apassionforpaws

and on Facebook @ 
https://www.facebook.com/pages/A-Passion-For-Paws-Rescue-Inc/95142903795

and on Twitter https://twitter.com/apassionforpaws

FOR COURTESY POSTINGS, PLEASE CONTACT THE SHELTER OR INDIVIDUAL LISTED DIRECTLY for more information on a particular dog.

Did you know that you can be a hero? If this homeless dog steals your heart and you can't adopt at this time, we would welcome you to sponsor his/her rescue and save a life. Let us know by emailing us at: apassionforpaws@gmail.com

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING ANIMAL RESCUE!

name: Addie - Your Best friend!
description:
ATTN: If you have questions, or are interested in meeting this fantastic pet, please visit our website at: www.goodkarmamn.org and click on Adoption Application.

Addie-Your Best friend!

Favorite pastimes:  Hanging around the house with my people, gazing out the windows, going for walks, and bones to chew on!

Lab mix

Spayed female

Approximately 3-4 years old

Approximately 67 pounds

Good with dogs? Yes

Good with cats? No

Good with kids? Yes

Crate trained? Yes-but very well behaved without too.

House Trained? Yes

Energy level:  Medium/Average

Shedding amount:  Average for breed

The roommate of a lifetime-Adeline will be there for the good times and the bad! She will greet you at the door and sit with you when you’re down. She will make you laugh often, she loves her people, and Adeline will do anything for a tasty treat! At meal times she gets so excited she dances then proceeds to eat her food so loud and fast you have to giggle; and if you rattle the treat bag she will come running! She’s so gentle when taking her treats that you wouldn’t even think she has teeth!  She isn’t attached to your hip and appreciates having her own doggy space too. Adeline is very content and easy going. Fridays and Saturday nights when you don’t want to do much of anything she’s happy to catch up on your favorite shows or just sit and peer through the windows. Are you ready for your new best friend?! She’s been waiting for you!

From her foster mom:  Adeline is honestly so sweet with a sprinkle of stubborn. She lightly snores when she sleeps and chews on bones when she’s bored. This girl is truly a doll!

My adoption fee is $325. All of Good Karma's dogs are current on heartworm/flea and tick preventative while in foster care, spayed/neutered, and are adopted with all age-appropriate distemper vaccines, rabies vaccine, deworming, microchip, and heartworm test (in dogs over 6 months of age). *Good Karma adopts out animals within a 60 mile radius of the Twin Cities, or a 30 minute radius of Duluth and Rochester*

Please visit www.goodkarmamn.org to fill out an adoption application. Once the application is received, and awesome representative of Good Karma will contact you to answer any questions you may have and/or set up a time for you to meet your new pet! Good Karma Animal Rescue’s approval process includes conducting a home visit before adopters take their new pet home.

**Note on breed and age determination: Good Karma Animal Rescue of MN bases our breed and age determinations on appearance, our own knowledge, veterinarian advice, and/or information from the sending shelters or previous owners. Because most of our adoptable dogs were previously in shelters, we can’t be 100% sure of a dog’s breed mix, and unless there is a specific date of birth listed, we can’t be 100% sure of a dog’s age. Additionally, our assessments of a dog's interactions with other dogs, cats, or children are based on OUR experiences. Your experience may differ.

name: PEBBLES
breed: Labrador Retriever / German Shorthaired Pointer / Mixed (medium coat)
description:
Meet Pebbles!! More proof that good things come in small packages!! <3 Pebbles was a wonderful mom to her pups, please enjoy the video of them playing together! 
 
She is so grateful for security and love, and likes to relax and enjoy snacks and attention and a game of fetch. Pebbles is *really* good at fetch AND catch! She’s quick, precise, catches the ball on the bounce or in mid-air and is very good about returning it right to your feet!
 
As Pebbles is very young, we are looking for a home for her where there is an adult home most of the time. Active humans are a must, especially if there are no other dog friends to play with. Since we lack fosters with young children, only families with gentle humans over eight years of age will be considered. Pebbles enjoys playtime with her Better Days siblings and she really loves spending time with the 11 year old son of one of our volunteers.
 
If you believe you're a possible match for Pebbles, please complete an adoption application!
 
Our fees and policies are on our home page at BetterDaysRescue.org. We encourage you to register on our site and "Favorite" the dog(s) that interest you, so that you will be notified when bio or photos are updated.

**IMPORTANT** If you are reading this on a pet search site, PLEASE navigate to our animal list http://www.betterdaysrescue.org/animals/list and rea d this dog's entire, detailed profile.

  • "Fenced yard" means, a backyard that is adjacent to and connected with your residence. (It does not mean a nearby fenced area/dog park.)
  • "Companion animal" means, needs at least one other friendly dog that lives in the same household.
  • We DO NOT adopt to students as we have found that they often do not know or anticipate where life is taking them next.

Dogs remain posted while we screen potential adopters. As long as dog is designated "Available" we continue to accept applications.

We are staffed by all volunteers and use an application protocol to handle all inquiries about adoptable dogs. This system enables an efficiency that allows us to save and care for more dogs. Discussion about a dog - including scheduling of a home check or other dialogue - cannot occur until we have received your completed adoption application. NO EXCEPTIONS. Thank you!

name: Lady Jane, Great girl, needs dog buddy
description:
Lady Jane came to us from another shelter after she'd been left in a night drop area there to have her puppies.  Her babies have all been adopted and now it's her turn!

We have no idea what breed she is.  She looks very much like a Doberman Pinscher, but is only 30 lbs.  Janie is a cuddler.  She loves to curl up right against you on the couch or on the bed if she's allowed.  She also really likes other dogs, so we are looking to find her a home with another canine companion, particularly one that is very people-friendly.  It seems as if Lady Jane did not get much exposure to other humans besides the ones she knows and loves, so she is unsure of new people, but we feel that with another dog to model friendly behavior for her, she will overcome that challenge quickly. 

Our Janie will make a fabulous pet for the right family.  She's beautiful, loving, listens well, and wants to please.  She will need someone with a bit of patience, understanding, and hopefully a gregarious canine sibling to help with her shyness of unfamiliar people. 

If Lady Jane sounds like a dog that would fit well as the newest member of your family, you can easily fill out an adoption application by clicking here: adoption application

For anyone viewing this on Petfinder, if you are interested in adopting this animal you will need to go to our website www.rosesrescue.net to fill out the online adoption application. You can usually find more pictures of the animals there too. Click on our name "Roses Rescue" in blue above to be taken directly to our website.

name: Magic Man - Needs Foster
description:
Magic man was pulled from Philly ACCT. His owner surrender sheet stated that he was good with all people. This boy is crate trained, and knows his basic commands. If your looking for a house trained adult that would make a great running partner this could be the guy for you!

Magic Man checking in! I LOVE people. I like to be held and carried like a baby. I love to sit on your lap and snuggle too. I know sit, paw and other paw. I am learning stay and lay down. I am not a super huge fan of the winter cold, but I love wearing coats! 

My Ideal home would be an active one. I like to walk and explore outside. Do you like to go for hikes? Jog? Run? I would LOVE to be your new running buddy.

Apply today to adopt Magic man.

 

Update 3/15/18: Magic man is learning general commands. He knows sit, wait, paw, other paw and crate. He is very food motivated and is eager to learn new tricks.

name: Roxie
description:
Roxie was rescued from Animal Control.  She is heart worm positive and has been started on treatment.  She is very sweet and does well with other dogs.

2 yrs old

The standard adoption fee is $150, but it may vary depending on the situation and the animal. This includes vetting such as shots, spaying or neutering, microchipping, deworming, and heartworm testing if the animal is over six months of age.

Please note****  We are a volunteer organization.  Adoption events are held every Saturday 10-2 at our facility located st 2049 Badin Rd.  Most of our animals are in foster homes.  Please contact the foster if you would like to meet one of our rescues.  

You may complete an application for approval to start the adoption process at www.stanlycountyhumanesociety.org, under the 'Adoption' tab.

Thanks for considering adopting a rescue pet!

Follow us on FaceBook!


Adoption fees for pets with Stanly County Humane Society are to cover the following:

*Spay/Neuter

*Heartworm/Feline Testing

*All standard vaccinations

*Rabies Vaccination

*Microchip

He is a lap dog lover and quite the character. We will never know his past but he has a new life chapter beginning now. Mr Magoo is neutered, up to date on his vaccines, has a microchip and got a dental which took the remaining of his teeth!

description:

If you would like to provide this dog a loving home, please fill out a pre-adoption application. 
Have a question? Please read our Frequently Asked Questions and Adoption Processed Explained documentation.

Statistics

Name: Kyler
Breed: Pekingese
Age:  4 Years 
Size: Small       20 lbs.          ~Small range: Up to 25 lbs 
Adoption Donation:  $180 (applicable sales tax included). Adoption fees may be paid with cash or check.
Other:  Neutered Male, Vaccinations current, Microchip

** Kyler suffers from skin allergies and Cushing's Disease (hyperadrenocorticism), which is a result of chronic overproduction of excess hormones from the adrenal glands. He will need to be on medications for life to manage these conditions. These medications cost about $195 a month.

 

 

Kyler is the boy for you! 

 

 

Foster Home Feedback

3/28/18: Hi, it’s me, Kyler. I’m the one on the right, with my friend Daisy. I am loving the warmer weather, so I can play outside with my buddies. I have learned how to use the stairs. They used to scare me, but my foster mom showed me how to use them. (Yea Foster Mom and yea me!) I am very sweet, laid back & get along with everyone. Check me out!

1/14/18: My name is Kyler. I love to play with my friend Daisy, snuggling in my bed, romping in the yard (when the weather is nice) and chewing on my Kong toy. I take medicine daily for my Cushings. I am potty trained, I’m pretty quiet & low key, and I kennel up. I do have a hard time with steps; they scare me. My foster mom carries me down to the fenced in yard. I like a “quieter” house, not sure on cats but maybe possible. My foster mom tells me I’m WONDERFUL!!

name: Nino
description:
Nino came to us in October in bad shape.  He was obviously extremely underweight, and it soon became apparent that there was more.  See, Nino was dealt a bad hand in life.  He has very few teeth, a skin condition and his ears...  Let's say that this poor guy most certainly endured a lot of pain.
But, Nino luckily got dealt a new hand, and he has been lovingly nurtured back to health by the wonderful dog volunteers at Last Hope!  He's at a great weight and his skiin is healing up nicely.  He's very affectionate and loves nothing more than lots of scratches (especially his hiney!) and snuggles and cuddles and hugs.  He will definitely try to climb up on your lap!   And boy, does this guy love his treats!
We're looking for a family for Nino that will give him nothing but love and attention.  He is very selective of his doggies friends.  We feel that he will be fine with older kids.  No cats, though!
 
Please meet Nino!  You'd never know by his sweet disposition that he was heartlessly abused.  All you see is a beautiful, healthy 2-year old blue pit ready to live the rest of his life with love and dignity!

name: Hansel
description:
Online Adoption Application ›


UPDATE:
Hansel has come around leaps and bounds in his foster home.  Although still skittish and fearful he has begun to seek out attention from the humans.  He bounces on the bed in the morning with his whole body wagging looking for a few minutes of attention and then runs outside to be with his doggie friends.  We are letting him progress at his own pace and he's doing very well.  He'll soon be ready to make some appearances at  our meet and greets. :)

Hansel came to us via an owner surrender/seizure case from Wayne County.  This poor boy has had little to no human interaction in his short life.  
As fearful as he is there is no aggression in his little body.  
Hansel is a great size at only 15 lbs.  He looks for comfort and confidence in his furry foster siblings.  He is not seeking out human interaction at this time but we do couch time every day for a few minutes to let him see that petting, hugging, and relaxing on the couch is a really comfy thing to do :)
I'm sure with time and patience Hansel will begin to love life with a human family!

Hansel came to us via an owner surrender/seizure case from Wayne County. This poor boy has had little to no human interaction in his short life. 
As fearful as he is there is no aggression in his little body. 
Hansel is a great size at only 15 lbs. He looks for comfort and confidence in his furry foster siblings. He is not seeking out human interaction at this time but we do couch time every day for a few minutes to let him see that petting, hugging, and relaxing on the couch is a really comfy thing to do :)
I'm sure with time and patience Hansel will begin to love life with a human family!

name: Regan - Ohio
breed: Terrier / American Pit Bull Terrier / Mixed
description:
Please contact City Dogs - Cleveland Animal Care and Control (tylersgirl815@aim.com) for more information about this pet.
 
*Provided by 
PBRC Courtesy  Dog Listings
 
**Please Note - Dogs Available Nationwide - * check (state) before applying. 
Access the adoption application included with this listing.

The easiest way to begin the communication and adoption process is by filling out an adoption application.

*****************************************

 
 

Adopt Me-$61.00

Regan is sweet, silly, and happy. She weighs 50 lbs.  If you have questions or would like to meet the dog featured on this page, please call (216) 664-3476 to speak to an adoption representative at CITY DOGS Cleveland. Or email citydogs@city.cleveland.oh .us.    If  you have questions or would like to meet the dog featured on this page, please call (216) 664-3476 to speak to an adoption representative at CITY DOGS Cleveland. Or email citydogs@city.cleveland.oh.us  About Our Shelter... CITY DOGS Cleveland is a program of Cleveland Animal Care & Control (CACC), located at 2690 W. 7th St. Cleveland, OH 44113. Public hours are Monday through Saturday from 10am-3pm, and Sunday 12-2pm. The CITY DOGS mission is to increase adoptions from the City Kennel by changing the image of the pit bulls who make up the majority of the kennel population, by preparing all adoptable dogs in the kennel for lives in loving homes and by creating as many opportunities as possible for the public to meet and get to know our dogs for the terrific pets they are meant to be.  Our Adoption Process... Here's a little about how things work: All of the CITY DOGS posted for adoption are available for direct adoption from the kennel, unless noted otherwise. A handful of dogs are only available for rescue pull, which can be for a variety of reasons. You can either stop in during our open hours to meet a dog, or set up a meet and greet with your dog, which allows us to get the dog out of his/her cage for some exercise before you arrive. To set up a meet and greet, please email us at citydogs@city.cleveland.oh.us. About Our Dogs: All available dogs have gone through the ASPCA SAFER Assessment. This assessment is a snapshot of who the dog is at that given time. Our dogs are strays and we cannot make any guarantees with regard to behavior, temperament or health of any City Dog. We do not know what kind of home environment they were living in (i.e. with kids, other dogs or other cats), nor do we know if they are house trained. Everything we know about them is based on volunteer and staff observations. It is very hard to tell with certainty whether or not a dog will be good with kids, cats or another dog. If you have kids in the home or another dog, we do require that they be present for a meet and greet with the dog you are considering for adoption. Heath/Vaccinations: Dogs that are adopted directly from the kennel need to go to your personal vet within a week or so of leaving the kennel. They do have their DHPP, Rabies and Bordetella vaccinations, are dewormed once and have a microchip. In addition, unfortunately many of the dogs do get kennel cough. This is not something that is contagious to people at all, but dogs that do have it will need to be on an antibiotic.     Physical qualities-  back to top  Physical qualities-  back to top  Physical qualities-  back to top  Physical qualities-  back to top  Physical qualities-  back to top      Physical qualities-  back to top  Physical qualities-

description:
*Provided by 
PBRC Courtesy  Dog Listings
 
**Please Note - Dogs Available Nationwide - * check (state) before applying. 
Access the adoption application included with this listing.

The easiest way to begin the communication and adoption process is by filling out an adoption application.

*****************************************

 
 

LOCATION: North Providence, Rhode Island

CONTACT: Alexandria Kersey Alex.kersey1@gmail.com

To Apply for Tulip: http://www.emailmeform.com/builder/form/4k11me3IX134Vtfabu

Adoption Fee: $75

My fiancé and I are down sizing our home and are looking to rehome our dog. We rescued her about a year ago, she was abused, but in my opinion you can't tell. She's so goofy and fun, and became a part of our family immediately. She's energetic but extremely cuddly, she's rather large (about 50-60lbs) but will sit right on your lap if you let her. She has had babies, but is fixed now and has all of her shots per the shelter she was in. She's been through formal training and is great around children. We actually have a cat as well but she generally keeps to herself so the dog doesn't see her much. She is only about 3 we believe, but she doesn't chew or destroy anything. Of course she would come with all of her items: leash, collar, raised food and water dishes, food, toys. We love her, it breaks out heart to see her go, but we can no longer accommodate her. We would love to see her go to a good home with pet experience. Shut MUST be the only dog in the home. Feel free to reach out for more info!


Please consider a donation to PBRC.   Your donations make a difference to countless dogs through spay/neuter, educating the public, promoting a positive image and finding them permanent homes.  Donate : http://www.pbrc.net/donate.html

name: Bear in PA - adopted
description:
Adoption Pending. You can see more of these beautiful dogs by clicking on Rescue Dogs.

NYS Registered Rescue # RR102

Children in the home must be at least 6 years old.
Previous dog experience is required, preferably large breed.

Bear will win you over with his great disposition the minute you see him! Wonderfully easy- going, he’s already a great hiking companion and will stay by your side all day on the trail. He loves his dog hiking buddies and plays well with others — both human and canine. If you aren’t into hiking, he also loves riding in the car and will make a perfect traveling companion. Bear has taken very well to learning his commands - he sits and comes to his name! This big, beautiful boy has a shorter, easy-maintenance coat and really enjoys being brushed - he will only become more handsome as he fills out. Not a big barker, Bear will “talk” to you and smile happily when given attention. Gentle and sociable, he will complement your family, and like any Pyr, will be a loving and loyal companion!

NGPR Pooch Profile

Name: Bear in PA

Age: 1 yr 9 mos old as of Feb. 2018

Color: All white fluffy coat

Dew Claws: yes double

Estimated Adult Weight: Currently 88 pounds but thin, needs to gain more weight

Current Location: NGPR approved foster in East Berlin, PA

Medical: Neutered, dewormed, negative for heartworm, up-to-date on vaccinations and currently on flea, tick and heartworm preventative. This dog travels with a Interstate Health Certificate required by the USDA confirming that all the above criteria have been met.

Housebroken: yes

Can be Placed With: Older Kids, Other Dogs, cats unknown

Fencing: Secure VISIBLE fencing is required; invisible fencing WILL NOT contain this breed. Bear will need a tall fence.

Fees: $475 adoption fee.

If you can't foster or adopt at this time, please consider helping our Neediest Cases.

Please visit our ADOPTION CENTER to complete the application form and learn more about Pyrs and our adoption process. Thanks.
About Us: National Great Pyrenees Rescue (NGPR) is not a shelter. We are a not-for-profit, tax-exempt coalition of Pyr rescuers and rescue groups. We save Pyrs and Pyr mixes across the country and place them in approved foster homes so we know how they will interact with your family. Please consider adopting or fostering. Every dog who is fostered or adopted makes room for another Pyr coming out of a kill shelter. Prior to adoption, NGPR dogs are fostered for a minimum of two weeks (usually more), spayed or neutered and fully vetted. Dogs coming from out of area are certified with a USDA health certificate before going to their new homes. Our rescuers adhere to the highest placement standards and will take back any dog whose adoption does not succeed. Visit www.nationalpyr.org to learn more about us, our mission and our breed.
More Information: Questions? The fastest way to learn more about a dog is to fill out the application form below. If you call or e-mail you are reducing your chances of adopting this animal as we direct our time and energy to first serving those who apply. For more information about our adoption process please visit our adoption information page.
Want to help but can’t adopt now? You can make a tax-exempt donation by visiting our donation page.
This exceptional Great Pyrenees dog has been selected for sponsorship by National Great Pyrenees Rescue (NGPR)We have many Pyrs and Pyr mixes who need homes and not all of them are posted. You can see more of these beautiful dogs by clicking on Rescue Dogs.

Love this breed? NGPR now has a Rescue Store where your purchase goes to help our rescue dogs and neediest cases.

name: Duckie
description:
STATS:
Female, Chi mix, 2-3 years, 8 lbs. Special Needs (Duckie wears a diaper inside which actually helps her mobility and balance.)

TEMPERAMENT:
Friendly!
Loving!
Outgoing!

SKILLS:
Good with dogs.
Good with cats.
Good with children.

MORE ABOUT ME:
She loves to play (indoor) fetch. She can play for hours. Indoors because she stays more focused on using her legs when she's on carpet :)

ONE LAST THING:
Duckie was left at Sun Valley Animal Hospital in Concord unable to use her back legs and she was timid and unsure. We didn't know what happened to her. Through therapy, thanks to the combined efforts of the ladies at Sun Valley Animal hospital and the crew over at Veterinary Healing & Advanced Imaging in Pleasant Hill, CA and the love and patience from Duckie's foster, she started using her legs and is now able to run around! It's not a perfect "run", and she still has special needs (wears a diaper inside), but her progress has been amazing!

We can't wait to see her continued progress and find her a forever home of her own! She lives with kids and other animals and loves to play. Help us continue to make her life story amazing by networking to help us find her home.

You can check out Duckie's progress on video @ K9 Paw Print Rescue's Facebook page under videos and search for "Duckie".

🐾 If you can give her a loving home, please send us an adoption app for her at www.K9ppr.org

name: Nikki
color: Black with Tan, Yellow or Fawn
description:
Nikki is a beautiful, happy,fun loving boy, approximately 5 months old.  He came to GSROC with to a rare birth defect called hypospadias.  This condition required specialty surgery that GSROC has completed.  Nikki doesn’t know that he’s any different from any other male puppy, despite having been born with under-developed genitals.

Our specialists tell us that Nikki should not have any health challenges as he matures.  He is looking for a shepherd-savvy home that has other dogs and humans with open minds and understanding hearts.

He is housebroken and loves to play with his foster brothers and sisters.  Nikki is always ready to have a good time.  He loves to play with toys and enjoys having his foster brothers chase him.

Please ask your vet about this condition before you apply to adopt Nikki to determine whether he would be the right match for your family.


Please go to our website and complete an adoption application at: http://www.gsroc.org/application.asp. An adoption counselor will contact you to go over your application and assist you in determining which dog may be best for your particular situation.

Please go to our website and complete an adoption application at: http://www.gsroc.org/application.asp. An adoption counselor will contact you to go over your application and assist you in determining which dog may be best for your particular situation.

name: Tucker
description:
5 year old Tucker is recovering from a foot injury but that doesn't mean he can't be adopted! He has lots of love to give.

 

UPDATE:  Tucker was been seen by our vet and thanks to generous supporters, he was able to get the care he needed.    The vet was able to save his paw – although he lost two toes.   He now has a splint on his foot while the incision heals.  It doesn’t seem to have slowed down Tucker.   He loves to jump and play.

Tucker has a gorgeous coat, fluffy and soft.   His tail is obviously his pride and joy – he wags it all the time.


Please go to our website and complete an adoption application at: http://www.gsroc.org/application.asp. An adoption counselor will contact you to go over your application and assist you in determining which dog may be best for your particular situation.

description: Pepper was dumped in an abandon field and saved right before Hurricane Harvey.  He is very sweet, but a little shy.  He loves his "hunny bunny" and loves his fellow foster kitty that he lives with.  He loves to eat and loves to cuddle.  He currently lives with dogs, cats and teenagers and does well.  Hismdate of birth is estimated to be 6/24/2017.  If interested in meeting Pepper Cat, please complete an application on our website at www.soca-fbc.org.

name: Libby - HOSPICE CARE
color: Black with Tan, Yellow or Fawn
description:
Hospice Care

LIBBY'S STORY:

With a heavy heart we announce that Libby is moving into our Hospice Program.

Lilly was discarded by her family and ended up on the euthanasia list in a southern shelter.  We stepped in and rescued this sweet senior girl and are heartbroken that she has an inoperable oral melanoma.  She will spend the remainder of her golden years in her loving foster home with her two foster sisters.  Libby will be kept as comfortable as she possibly can be until her time to cross the Rainbow Bridge comes.

Please keep Libby and her foster family in your thoughts and prayers during this difficult time.  

Should you want to donate to Libby's care, please go to www.dobermanrescueminnesota.com and click on the donate button and reference Libby.

This fabulous foster is a Doberman Rescue Minnesota foster dog.

Please read all adoption steps and policies carefully on our website. http://dobermanrescueminnesota.com/adoption-steps/

Qualified adopters are within the approved adoption area, and Adopter will be requested to visit this foster dog at the foster family home. Our foster families are generally located within a 250 mile radius of Minneapolis, MN.

All DRM dogs are spayed/neutered, vaccinated, health checked, microchipped, dewormed, 4DX tested, and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm prevention.

name: Tootsie
color: White with Red, Golden, Orange or Chestnut
description:
Approx. DOB: 05-10-10                 Approx. Weight: 14 Lbs

Adoption Fee: $200  includes a 2 week trial to ensure everyone's happiness!

Tootsie's Dad passed away and his family decided they didn't want her so they just dumped her!  However, they didn't know that she was microchipped. When she was found by a kind person who had her scanned, they were able to trace her history by the chip. 

Tootsie is with us now and we will find her the perfect forever family! Tootsie ia a very sweet fun loving little dog however....

Tootsie DOES NOT like other dogs at all, please no cats either.  Children in the home need to be older then 10. A fenced yard will be required, no underground fences. 

I have been spayed, vaccinated, heartworm tested negative and microchipped.  If you are interested in adopting me, please complete the adoption application located at www.furrykidsrefuge.org/adoptadog and a dedicated volunteer will get back to you as soon as possible.

 


Furry Kids' Refuge is in need of good quality dog and puppy food with meat as the first ingredient.  You can drop off donations at our weekly adoption events at the Lee's Summit Petco (1860 NW Chipman Road, Lee's Summit, MO), Saturdays only from Noon to 4:00 p.m.  Donations are tax deductible as allowed by law. 

Would you like to foster a Furry Kid? Furry Kids' Refuge will supply the food & vet care while you supply the basic house rules & love.......win-win for all!!  Just visit our website http://www.furrykidsrefuge.org/category/fostering/  for more information. Thanks for your support!

name: AGATHA
description:
COURTESY POSTING. Agatha is not part of UHA's Shelter Support Program.

CONTACT: Katja at 951-973-2757 or katja@hope4animals.org.

AGATHA is a charming 7-month-old spayed female calico kitten who was rescued by a good Samaritan along with her sister. Weighing around 6 lbs and with an expected adult weight of about 10 lbs, Agatha has a long, slender body and beautifully delicate features. She is living in a foster home that includes a child and dogs, and she gets along well with everyone (and loves to be held by her little human sister). Agatha enjoys sitting on your lap and snuggling. She is a lovely kitten who will be a purrfect addition to a loving home in which she will be an indoor cat.

Agatha is litter-box trained, spayed, microchipped, and current on vaccines. 

For more information about Agatha, please contact Katja at 951-973-2757 or katja@hope4animals.org.

name: Alexander
description: Alexander has a skip in his step now that he's been rescued from Hurricane Harvey and made his way to a safe, secure shelter. All he wants now is to move on to a new forever home. Alexander is a super lovebug and greets everyone with a smile. Before long, he's rolled over on his back looking for belly-rubs. Alexander loves giving hugs to his new human friends and seems to adore everyone he meets. He's also very playful - Alexander loves to play catch and tug of war, and if nothing else, he'll entertain himself running around holding his own leash. While Alexander is full of energy during playtime, he is also well-mannered and knows when to chill out and settle for some cuddle time. One of his APA! friends says "he just radiates calmness." That's until you show him a toy, then he's ready to party! Another favorite quirk of Alexander's is how happy he looks when he rolls around on the ground to scratch his back. He loves going for rides in the car and also, very adorably, in a golf cart. On top of being all around adorable, Alexander is a rockstar in his TOP Dog training. The Total Obedience Program (TOP) is modeled after the AKC's Canine Good Citizen (CGC) test. As a TOP dog, Alexander has a personalized training plan and works with a volunteer trainer several times a week to help him learn the skills to become the best dog he can be! He is learning skills like sit and down, walking nicely on leash, sitting calmly when approached by strangers or other dogs, staying in a sit or down until told "free" and coming when called. Once Alexander successfully completes all the skills on his training plan he will be considered TOP Dog Ready! Alexander is working hard to become a wonderful companion and as a part of APA's Total Obedience Program you can work with APA staff to continue to build a training relationship with Alexander after adoption and master all the TOP dog skills together. Check out a video on APA's CGC program, on which the TOP was based: https://vimeo.com/89434193 Alexander's soulful eyes tell you he's grateful to be part of the APA! family but hopes to become a new addition to a home with new people and new toys to play with. Come meet this sweet boy!

name: Remy
description:
REMY ~7 years old. Good with older considerate kids and dogs. Needs a companion animal.  Not good with cats.

GSRA adopts to residents of VA, NC, and SC only

Remy is a sweet boy who loves his humans very much and whines when they are not around. He loves his furry squeaky toys. The more squeak the better! He wishes his foster sister would play with him but she sprained an ankle chasing squirrels with him! He will make a great addition to a family. He is a little protective of “his property” and is house/crate trained. He is very SMART and a quick learner! He is responding well to training with sit/lay down. He rides great in the car and walks perfectly on a leash (left). Remy is still very new to over stimulating events like the pet store and has trouble remembering his commands but we are working on that. He will be there to greet you when you get home waiting for a pet! He’s a leaner and affectionate.

Remy still needs to go thru HW treatment.


For more information on our adoptable pet list please visit: Adoptable Pet List

Please join us at our next Event(s):

Current Scheduled Events:

name: Hank
breed: German Shepherd Dog / Belgian Shepherd Malinois / Mixed (medium coat)
description:
HANK ~2 years old. Good with dogs. Not good with kids or cats.  Needs a companion animal.

GSRA adopts to residents of VA, NC, and SC only

Hi, my name is Hank and I'm ready to bring us both many years of happiness and joy! I look forward to meeting my new forever family and giving them big Hank kisses and hugs.
Right now I am staying with my foster family and enjoy playing with my foster sister (Luna the lovable lunatic) and Majestic my pitbull foster brother. We play together, share toys and even eat out of the same bowls! I quickly learned their rules and we had no issues at all.
I can be demanding at times, like when I want loving or when I need to go out. I might argue with you or bark (a high pitched yelp) so I need someone who understands me and has the patience to teach me other ways to communicate. I also have a small habit of "nipping" when I first see you in the morning but I don't mean any harm. I just Luvz everyone! Usually all you have to do is say "Hank house" and I will quite down. If I don't then you can be pretty sure I'm letting you know I need to go potty. I really believe this little fur balls that run around teasing me and meowing at me were put on earth just to torture me so I prefer not to live with one if possible. Hank out for now!


For more information on our adoptable pet list please visit: Adoptable Pet List

Please join us at our next Event(s):

Current Scheduled Events:

name: Billy Jo
description: Meet Billy Jo! This little cutie is about 7 months old. She was rescued by the Verona Street Animal Society in Rochester. Billy Jo is very shy and timid, she is frightened by loud noises and fast movements. Once she warms up to you she is sweet and enjoys petting. She is also very playful, she loves toys, especially wand toys! Billy Jo would do best in a quiet home. Billy Jo is not the biggest fan of other cats.

name: Pojo
description:
Meet Pojo! This handsome fella is about 7 years old. He was rescued by the Verona Street Animal Society in Rochester, poor Pojo was surrendered because his owner had "too many animals". Pojo is super sweet and friendly! He loves to be petted! He is also very patient. Pojo is FIV+,  FIV stands for feline immunodeficiency virus and it typically causes a weakening of the cat's immune system. 

Check out this helpful link to learn more about FIV

http://www.vet.cornell.edu/fhc/Health_Information/brochure_fiv.cfm
descriptionPlain:
Meet Pojo! This handsome fella is about 7 years old. He was rescued by the Verona Street Animal Society in Rochester, poor Pojo was surrendered because his owner had "too many animals". Pojo is super sweet and friendly! He loves to be petted! He is also very patient. Pojo is FIV+,  FIV stands for feline immunodeficiency virus and it typically causes a weakening of the cat's immune system.    

 Check out this helpful link to learn more about FIV

 http://www.vet.cornell.edu/fhc/Health_Information/brochure_fiv.cfm

name: Ira D172018
description:
Name: Ira
Age: DOB approx. 10/23/14
Gender: Male
Breed:  Pitty 
Weight: 70
Dog friendly: Yes
Cat friendly: No
Kid friendly: Yes
House Trained: Yes
Crate Trained: Yes
Energy level: Moderate
History: Pulled from an animal control 
Adoption Fee: $350.00 

 

From the Foster:

Ira is a three year old Pit Bull with a white coat and a prominent black dot on his bum.  A very distinguished, handsome boy.  He is house trained, enjoys being in his crate, and understands basic commands but is capable of much more,
 
In my 28 years I have never met a more loving, loyal dog.  He gets his energy from your energy.  If you feel like lounging and watching Netflix he'll lay with you through an entire season of The Office.  If you want to jog a 5k he'll be by your side the entire way.
 
Cats are out of the question.  The only time he has barked is at a cat and the vacuum.  He does get along with submissive dogs if introduced properly.  Lots of time and space to feel each other out before a formal meeting.  Ira is not a dog park kind of guy.
 
He becomes very attached to the primary care taker.  His happiest place to be is wherever you are.  However, he did learn that bedrooms are off limits.    
 
If multiple people divide the feeding and walks among themselves he should grow attached to everyone.  He gets very excited meeting new people at home or on walks.  Young or old, Ira loves everyone.  

Ira was recently treated for heartworms - please let SHH know if you have any questions.

name: Jack D172019
description:
Name: Jack
Age: DOB Approx. 10/24/08
Gender: Male
Breed:  Pitty
Weight: 55
Dog friendly: Yes
Cat friendly: TBD
Kid friendly: Yes
House Trained: Yes
Crate Trained: Yes but does bark (no shared walls!)
Energy level: Moderate
History: Pulled from an animal control 
Adoption Fee: $300.00 

 

From the Foster:

Jack is a naughty, sassy, old man that adores attention and knows some solid commands (sit, down (lie down), off, wait, and touch). He's a counter surfer that knows the word "off" and will throw his head back, bark, and run to you wagging his booty to tell you that he wouldn't have to counter surf if you'd just feed him all the things on the counter. Sass.
 
He's crate trained in the sense that he doesn't destroy any bedding or make any messes, but he's very vocal about his displeasure of being kenneled like a "dog". In a new environment he may be vocal for up to an hour before settling, His ideal home would require no kenneling but he does chill out once on a schedule. I would call him potty trained despite his short boycott of going outside to potty when it first got cold (literally one day, one accident inside). Jack is a master cuddler and would most likely excel if put to work as a therapy doggo for the elderly and at children's hospitals since he automatically sits and adores pets from anyone willing to indulge. He's a gentle guy that doesn't jump on new friends unless they decide to ignore him after his perfect patient sit and wait for scritches. Jack loves a good walk and likes to stop and say hi to every human he passes. He has a calm demeanor and sweet waggy tail that draws everyone to him. 
 
Jack would benefit from someone with breed experience (boxer, pittie, intelligent, maybe a tad manipulative). He's eager to please when you're fair in your requests. He walks nicely on leash if you give him some guidance. 
 
Jack has not been around cats at my house but I'd guess he is capable of living peacefully with kitties. Jack is pretty cool with other dogs but gets a bit awkward when over stimulated. I'd say he would benefit from slower intros if you have a dominant dogs. I have not seen any type of aggression from him but I've not put him any situations where he has to make his own decisions with dominant dogs. 
 
He's a super sweet, adorable dude that obviously deserves only the best!

name: Cayce
description:
Cayce was born around may 2017.  She was abandoned when her family left their home and she was left outside. She stayed in some bushes for a month and was fed by a neighbor who realized that she was there. She was thin and shut down.  She is a gentle big kitten who needs a loving home that will give her affection and a calm environment.  She will lean her head into you when she is being petted and she responds to cuddling with a quiet purr.  She is just waiting to blossom in the right home. She has a lovely white undercoat under her jet black fur.

Come and meet her on Saturdays from 12-4 at Harbison Petsmart adoption events.

name: Sebastian & Piper-special needs
description: My name is Sebastian and my sisters name is Piper. We both have Cerebellar Hypoplasia. For those who don't know what CH is, in a nutshell, it's a condition where the cerebellum, the part of the brain that controls movement and balance, was not mature at birth. This most likely happened because my mother was exposed to a virus while pregnant. There are many degree of CH and I have a mild case and Piper has a moderate case. Our condition will not get worse, but it isn't something that will go away. We both will, however, learn to control our wobbly walk. I am a little timid because I have a hard time running away and hiding. We play with other kittens, sometimes they run faster than we can.  We both use a litter box just fine! We live just as long as a cat that don't have CH. We would love someone who is patient and understanding of our condition to adopt us. We are best friends and would really LOVE to be adopted together. We have a lot of love to offer!

name: Sophie
description:
Hello, my name is my Sophie and I'm a 1 year old spayed female Colorpoint Shorthair mix. I'm declawed and have very limited vision in one of my eyes so I will need to be an indoor only cat. I'm affectionate once I get to know you but can get nervous with loud sounds or quick movements, due to this I'm looking to find an cat savvy adult only home or one with older teens. I've had a rough start in my life and now looking to be the only pet in the home and heart! If you are interested in meeting me please ask for Sophie ID#A830350.


Unless otherwise indicated, adoptable animals are located at our Lantos Center for Compassion at 1450 Rollins Road, Burlingame, CA 94010. Our hours are weekdays from 11am-7pm and weekends from 11am-6pm (closed major holidays). Interested adopters must arrive at least 1 hour before close. 

We do our best to update our listings regularly, but we can’t guarantee every animal you see is still available. It’s also typical for us to have animals who haven’t had their photos taken yet, so you are welcome to visit our adoption center and have a look around!

To check on an animal's adoption status, please call 650-340-7022 during normal business hours to speak with an adoption counselor or 650-340-7022 ext. 823 anytime to hear a recording of our available animals (updated each morning). Emails will be returned as soon as possible, but please allow up to 48 hours during busy adoption periods like weekends.

name: Paige
description:
Paws Crossed Dog Rescue serves the Eastern Panhandle of WV and nearby areas.  Please read "Adoption Info" on the left side of our website.

Paige comes to us as an owner surrender.  They just didn't want her anymore.  It's so sad, as she was really missing her old family for a while, but now that she's adjusted in her new, loving foster home, she's come out of her shell and has more easily accepted the transition.  She's a good old girl, somewhat overweight, but loves to play!  She's in a foster home with other dogs, so we know she's fine with other dogs, she's great with kids, and we're not sure about cats.

If you have it in your heart and home to love this older gal, please submit an adoption application.  Senior don't ask for much... just love, patience, clean water, and good food.  Help us find Paige her forever, loving home!

Email inquiries can be made to PawsCrossedDogRescue@yahoo.com

description:

Dog Adoptions   Cat Adoptions

name: Claire
description:
KNOCKOUT PUNCH! OK now this one you will have to move on quickly. Isn’t gorgeous Claire the epitome of tuxies, which are coming into vogue based on adoption statistics. Tuxies go quickly and you will even find a Yahoo Groups Tuxedo Cat page here:

https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/Tuxedo_Cats/info

Tuxies are very special and Claire is a knockout! She would love a home with another cat or two as she is playful and will lovingly groom her step-sibs. And, she will keep you close at heart in return for a caring and loving home. Can you resist? Please don’t! Claire is your girl waiting to happen!

Note:  if you do not have any other pets, we require that you adopt TWO kittens.  This is for the benefit of the kitten for behavioral development.  Companionship is critical.  They will also entertain each other and you!  

We offer a low cost spay and neuter package.

 

This cat has tested FeLV/FIV. negative, is current on vaccinations, parasite-free and litter-box trained. 
To hasten the adoption process, please complete our adoption form online at http://bit.ly/1dGdYS8 .

You can meet many of our pets at these locations:

  • Pet Valu in Wayne PA 317 Lancaster Avenue
  • Pet Valu in Ardmore PA at 217 West Lancaster Avenue
  • Pet Valu in Newtown Square at 3741 West Chester Pike

For information call or text Pat Maloney at 610-299-1860, email us at 4palsvolunteers@gmail.com or complete our adoption form at www.palspets.org

If you would like to volunteer or foster, please complete our volunteer or foster forms at www.palspets.org
Thank you!

name: Coley
description: Foster mom notes:  She is a sweet curious thing!  She loves to watch the fish tank (see pic). She actually wants me to pick her up and hold her so she can watch. (there is a lid on the tank, so she can't get to the fish). She loves belly rubs and is a little talker when i get home in the afternoon, like she is telling me about her day. She is super quiet at night, doesn't ever wake me up. She is unsure about other cats in her immediate vicinity.  Her and the dogs are not best friends, but they are fine together. She has places to go if she doesn't want to be around them. And she LOVES her cat tower. I am happy to let that go with her to her new home, she loves it that much!

name: Snubbull
description:
19 Dec 2017: 

Snubbull has been in foster for almost two months and is doing well. You may remember we pulled Snubbull from a rural shelter. She was heartworm positive and has a cleft palate, two factors that kept getting her passed over for adoption. She is now safe with us, getting treatment for her heartworm. Her cleft palate does not affect her at all, and we think it just makes her more endearing. Snubbull gets along well with other dogs and is also OK with cats. Please submit an application at http://www.nycsecondchancerescue.org/app-form/ to adopt this loving girl.

name: Wyatt
description:
Meet amazingly handsome, sweet Wyatt! 
We rescued Wyatt at 4m old from the shelter because he needed a TPLO surgery on one of his knees. After a few months of healing he's ready to meet his forever family. 

Wyatt is approx 9 m old he's house broken and crate trained, loves the company of other friendly dogs of all sizes and is great with kids! 
We think he's pretty much the perfect family dog and know once you meet him you will too!

This cute dog is available for adoption through Brother Wolf Animal Rescue, come by the adoption center and meet him!

 Individuals interested in adopting a puppy are STRONGLY encouraged to download and read this FREE ebook. Even if you've raised puppies in the past, this is an invaluable resource to help make your new addition successful!

 
 Please note that visual breed identification of companion animals has been proven to be unreliable, so for most of our animals we provide a best guess at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each of our animals as an individual and do our best to describe and place pets based on personality not breed label.

 Closed Tuesday

name: Danarys (GOT)
description:
Oh, hey! Let me guess: You need a cat in your life. It’s your lucky day! I am a young, female black and white domestic short-haired kitten who has been searching for just the right human(s) to give me lots of love—oh, and pet me, too! And would you mind throwing my ball? I’ll chase it again and again when I’m not sitting in my cat tree to get a glimpse of the world outside the windows.

But don’t worry! I might just be a kitten, but I’m also pretty independent, and I have very good litter box habits.

If you'd like to take me home, please fill out an adoption application at this website -http://www.animalalliesrescue.org/adoption-application and choose me - Danarys! My adoption fee is $150 and includes all of my routine vetting, rabies and distemper/parvo vaccinations, FelV/FIV testing (kitties), deworming, spay/neuter surgery, heartworm testing, monthly heartworm prevention, microchip, boarding and transportation costs if applicable, along with a free* trial offer for 30 days of 24PetWatch pet insurance!

name: zz "Jorryn" Courtesy Post
description:
THIS IS A COURTESY POST. Purrfect Friends Cat Rescue and its volunteers have not evaluated this animal in any way and can not be held liable for the current condition or future care of the animal. Please work with the specific contact in the posting to confirm if the animal is spayed/neutered, vaccinated, tested, etc. and for a complete description of the animal's personality and behavior traits.

Handsome JORRYN, approx 1 year old of 2017 (b'date January of 2017) is not only drop-dead, good-looking but quite affectionate once he knows that he can trust you; and he gets along well with other cats.  He's got a gorgeous swirled tabby coat with high contrast white points (chest & paws); and a white blaze down his nose.  He's looking for a family that will commit to him and give him the wonderful life that he deserves!  We estimate that he was born in mid January 2017.

Jorryn was dumped as a tiny kitten at a trailer park in the Hamilton-Ross area.  He was devastated and living in fear of his new surroundings.  It took a little work to get our hands on him, but we did and have had him fully vetted to ensure that he's healthy & ready to go.  He's been fostered in someone's home for quite awhile, learning to appreciate the good life of a warm bed, regular meals and loving hands.

Jorryn has been neutered, vaccinated, and tested negative for FIV/Felv.  His adoption fee is $50 to help cover part of the expenses put into helping him.  If you are interested in adopting this handsome, tenderhearted boy, please contact Dawn at 513/795-6631
