name: Buddy
description:
Born around December of 2013, Buddy is a big old boy who is just a hunka hunka burnin' love! The reason we posted a pic of his belly is that if you come to meet him, that might be all you see becaus he LOVES tummy rubs. He is a friendly, happy and energetic boy (though at the moment, he could stand to lose a pound or two ;). He loves to run and play fetch with squeaky toys, play tug, go for walks and generally be with his people. He also knows basic commands like Sit, Down, Paw and Come. He is very smart, so he learns very quickly.  

Please call the shelter at 309.246.4275 so we can tell you more about him! He is neutered, micro-chipped and current on all his shots.

name: Zinnea
description:
Sweetest little lady! This love seemed to just be patiently waiting for her luck to change. She was spotted sitting on a porch for months waiting to go inside. Unfortunately, the person living there didn’t own her or have room with her current resident cats.  When she arrived in her foster home she was one of the most grateful cats they had ever seen! She has put on weight and her fur has grown back thick and glossy! She has proven herself to be very playful and loving and would do well with other cats and dogs.

If you want to meet Zinnea, please submit an application on our website: application.

And if you can't adopt but would like to help, fostering is always an option! Either fostering CiCi or one (or more) of our other irresistibly cute feline companions.

You can also schedule a play date and meet some of our affectionate rescues by visiting Le Cat Cafe. Schedule a visit today!

name: Sammy
description:
Sammy is a handsome boy who was born in November of 2012. He had kind of a rough start to his life, being left outside with no human interaction most of the time. When he first came to us he was kind of indifferent to people because he never had much to do with them. But now that he has learned that people bring him good things, he is friendly and very polite in his greetings (no jumping up with this boy). He now loves attention and affection and is very sweet. He loves to be right with his people, and even loves to cuddle! 

Sammy gets along well with most other dogs, and he loves his peanut butter chewies too! 

Sammy is neutered, micro-chipped and current on all his shots.

name: Ana
description:
Birthdate: July, 2017

Cerebellar Hypoplasia ("CH") Kitten Needs You1

My name is Ana and I'm a sweet, playful, curious and adventurous kitten.  Actually, I'm a little dynamo - running around and playing with any toy I can get my paws on.

You will notice that I wobble when I walk and that's because I was born with a condition called Feline Cerebellar Hypoplasia ("CH") in which a part of the brain that controls fine motor skills and coordination is underdeveloped at birth which results in walking and balance issues.  Some people refer to CH cats as the "drunken sailor" or "wobbly cats" but I prefer to be called the "hula girl".

So I guess, CH is the fancy way of saying that I have balance issues but I can do everything that any kitten my age does but some things I have to do my own way - I am differently-abled.

There are different degrees of CH, ranging from mild to severe cases and I'm lucky to only have a very mild case of CH.  I'm not sick or hurt, I have no pain or discomfort, my condition will not worsen as I get older, and I'm not contagious to other cats and my life expectancy is the same as a cat without CH.

I'm just a regular kitten in every way and it doesn't affect my health or my behavior - I'm just mildly uncoordinated but I make up for it with my personality!

Currently there is no treatment for this condition.  However, cats with CH learn how to compensate for their condition, which leads to a full and happy life.

There's no reason to be scared of me, so please consider giving me a warm and loving home because I love and purr just as much as any other kitten.

You can fill out an application for Ana at the Aventura  Petsmart or go to www.adoptastray.ws/applications/ to fill out an application online or print and fax one to (954) 965-0406.

Petsmart employees are not familiar with the cats available through Adopt A Stray.  Please contact Adopt A Stray directly.

Learn more about Adopt A Stray by visiting our website www.adoptastray.ws.

name: Pepe
Cabazon
breed: Pointer / American Pit Bull Terrier / Mixed
description:
Cabazon is a 1 year old pointer mix. About 60 lbs. He was rescued from a shelter not long ago. He's a gentle giant and loves getting cuddles. But he is a big young dog, and has a lot of energy! He does well with his small dog friends- one of our smallest dogs was Cabazon's best friend before being adopted.  His main issue we've seen is that he can be territorial, and may not like it when new dogs come into his territory.

He's had his shots, is microchipped, has been neutered, and is ready for his new home!

We're not sure of his breed/mix - The shelter called him a pit bull mix- legs a bit short; his head, though big, is not that of a pitbull - ears are placed more forward.  From his lying down photo, we would not say "pit" - whatever he is, very sweet and loving - ignores barking little dogs completely.

His favorite thing is to get a head massage!  Would be ideal for a retired single or couple who have a relaxed lifestyle, sit on the couch or patio and rub this guy's huge head!  Hey, maybe he's a Genie!  It's sure worth some tries - relaxing for everyone.  Good emotional support dog...xoxo


​ Are you my furrever family?

For further info on the adoption process, please visit our home page and check out the "Adopt a Dog" section where very thorough instructions await.  All our dogs are spayed/neutered, micorchipped, and  fully vaccinated before adoption; they have been wormed, bathed, socialized, walked daily and much loved; each adoptee leaves with a leash, collar, and all medical records.  

The beauty of coming to our Apple Valley sanctuary is that you can see all 90+ dogs!   No more weekend mobiles—only special events. Maybe if there are enuff appointments, we could see you in  El Monte or Orange County or nearby. Email your application and ask for more details!

Sponsor Me

Beagles & Buddies must find ways to raise money so we can continue saving dogs. Your tax-deductible donation keeps our rescue kennel operating!

  • Monday: CLOSED

Weekday appointments may be available.  We are a small staff and do our best to accommodate your needs.

For more specific questions, pls call 626-444-9664 (pls leave a voicemail if no answer).  Emailing  is always welcomed & preferred!   Thanks!

name: Ollie & Pumpkin
description:
Ollie and Pumpkin belonged to an elderly man, who sadly passed away. They are shy at first, and rely on each other for comfort, so they must be adopted together. They are loving and well-mannered cats. Ollie is a large, black, beautiful guy. Pumpkin is a very pretty, fluffy long haired girl! Indoor only.

If you are interested in adopting this cat, please call Sheri at 435-787-1751 or send an email to scfourpaws@hotmail.com. The adoption fee is $125 for both cats, which includes the spay/neuter surgery and vaccinations. Please be patient with us getting back to you as we are all volunteers with full-time jobs and/or families! Thank you for your interest in this wonderful cat!

To check out some of our other great cats, go to:

Four Paws Cats

Sandy is current on her vaccinations and spayed.

For more information about Sandy or to meet her,  please contact AEdgerton@ahslink.com

name: Joe (woodlyn rd)
Elsa
breed: Nova Scotia Duck-Tolling Retriever / Border Collie / Mixed (long coat)
description:
Sweet 5 month old Elsa is ALL PUPPY! She is active and playful and ADORABLE; She is EXTREMELY loving... just wants cuddles, kisses, and attention.  She is looking for her forever home with an active family who is excited to play with her and keep her busy. Recently we learned that Elsa is showing some resource guarding behavior with food and toys. We are working with her, but her forever home must be free of small children and other pets.  Her forever home should have a yard and a fence... she is not an apartment dog... We imagine her doing extremely well as a active, busy, frisbee-catching, agility course running, master!  She is extremely smart, already knows lots of commands, and would love to have lots of training and activities that challenge her mind and body.  Please ONLY apply if you have no other pets, no small children, a single family home with fenced yard, and a willingness to be her playmate and trainer.  Breed experience a plus.


To be considered as this pet's adopter, please go to www.oneloveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html to complete your application.

name: Meco
breed: Doberman Pinscher / Pit Bull Terrier / Mixed (medium coat)
description:
It is hard to imagine why someone would move and leave this sweet boy to fend for himself - but that's exactly what happened.  Life in the kill shelter did not agree with him and thanks to a kind person, he was able to leave the shelter until Eleventh Hour Rescue could step in and take him.

Meco is sweet to all people and rolls right over for a belly rub.  He is good with other dogs, too!! Meco is up to date on his shots and microchipped. His foster mom reports that he is wonderful at home. He lives with two dogs is wonderful with them. Meco kissed everyone at the vet's office and he seems to be perfect in every way!! He is house trained and does not damage anything when left alone. Meco would do best in a quiet environment without children as too much commotion can be too much for him but would do well with another dog. He is a cuddly boy who would be great company while watching TV !!

Please consider being the family that this sweet boy truly deserves. If you would like to give Meco a home for the holidays, please fill out an adoption application at www.ehrdogs.org and be sure to mention his name, MECO!

His foster mom reports that he is wonderful at home. He lives with two dogs is wonderful with them. Meco kissed everyone at the vet's office and he seems to be perfect in every way!! He is house trained and does not damage anything when left alone. Meco would do best in a quiet environment without children as too much commotion can be too much for him but would do well with another dog. He is a cuddly boy who would be great company while watching TV !!

 Please consider being the family that this sweet boy truly deserves. If you would like to give Meco a home for the holidays, please fill out an adoption application at www.ehrdogs.org and be sure to mention his name, MECO!

name: Goober
breed: American Pit Bull Terrier / Bulldog / Mixed (short coat)
description:
Hey all, I am the Goober and these wonderful people at The Rescue Crew took me in from a local animal shelter after I was found wandering the streets all by myself.  I had something wrong with my eye, it's better now, but I do have to have some stuff put in it right now but that may not always have to happen.  But I don't mind having it put in, but between you and me, I don't like it much either.

Oh, here's the good stuff - I love car rides, I love to snuggle with you, I love to play with other dogs (but I have been told that I can get a bit rough, hey, that what us pit bull type dogs do!).  Plus, I am crate and potty trained!  I don't play with toys much, but I do love a good cow hoof!

I'm pretty good on a leash and I just love to go for walks.  But I'm not a fan of the cold, so I do need a coat on when it's cold out.

One thing that I don't like are cats.  I just don't understand them, they make funny little noises!  I'm not sure about small dogs either, I just kinda like things my size the best.

I've over heard people saying that I have some allergies.  But, I'm on a pretty good food right now and that seems to be helping.  I don't itch as much or lick my paws.  There are times that I lick my paws just because I'm bored!

So, if you are missing a Goober in your life, go ahead and complete and application!  Maybe we can snuggle the winter away!

name: Rita
description: My name is Rita. I kept having babies so I had an operation to not have any more. Some of my babies came to this place but I got to go home to my Daddy. But then my Daddy passed away and nobody wanted me so now I'm reunited with my grown-up babies. I'm a quiet girl, curious and playful once I get to know you. I am microchipped and UTD on shots. If you want to adopt me you have to fill out a form at www.lifelongfriends.org/adoptions. You must live in Texas to adopt me.

name: Dakota
description:
Name: Dakota
DOB: 1 year old
Weight: 6 lbs
Adoption Fee: $75 in the month of April

Hi everyone! My name is Dakota and I am looking for the perfect forever family.  I am a very independent girl who is most active when everyone is sleeping, or no one is home. I get along very well with other cats (I currently live with 1) as well as cat savvy dogs (I currently live with 5!).  But humans, man those things are scary!  You see, I came from a home that had over 100 cats and we didn’t have much human interaction, so the whole human thing is new and a little bit scary for me.   I’ve been at my foster home for a few months now, and my foster mom says that I have come a long way from when I got there so she thinks with time and patience from my forever family, one day, humans won’t be as scary to me.  My foster mom also thinks that a quieter forever home will help me come out of my shell more and warm up to you.


I love to explore the house and find nice warm places to sleep and lounge around.  I also love to sit at the top of my cat tower and watch the dogs. I love it when my foster mom puts treats out for me to eat! I will sometimes even cuddle up with the resident dogs (when they are calm and let me).  I am a very shy girl who has had a rough start to life so I am looking for a forever family who understands this and will continue to help me become less shy around humans.  My foster mom said it would be best if I would go to a home with another cat to help me open up and become less scared. 

Do I sound like I could be the purrfect fit for your family?  Fill out an application today and we can find out! 

 

If you are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org. An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.

Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals!

All Ruff Start dogs and cats are spayed/neutered, up to date on age appropriate vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm prevention (dogs) as well as heartworm tested (dogs).

Ruff Start Rescue is a foster based rescue. Animals are located in homes throughout Minnesota. We do not have a facility where animals are kept.

Ruff Start Rescue Adoption Policies: http://www.ruffstartrescue.org/info/display?PageID=11744

name: Garfield
description:
Meet Garfield! He is a six year old Dometic Short Hair. Garfield is shy at first but warms up quickly. He likes to lay in the sun, and like most cats - enjoys attention on his "terms". This sweet boy would love a forever home that would spoil him. If you would like to make Garfield a part of your family, fill out an application at www.barktownrescue.org. 

GARFIELD'S ADOPTION FEE IS $40


The shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at the dog's predominant breed or breed mix. We strongly encourage you to select your new pet by looking at each dog's individual personality and pet qualities rather than relying on a breed label that is only our best guess. 

 

Our adoption fees vary from $150 and up.  All of our dogs are up to date on vaccines, heart worm preventives, and flea/tick medication, and will be spayed/neutered prior to adoption. Portions of your adoption fee also help care for the sick and injured animals that we take in.  Thank you for supporting us and considering a rescue dog!

name: Blaine
description:
Name: Blaine
DOB: 1 year old
Weight: 5 lbs
Adoption Fee: $75 in month of April.

 

Blaine is a sweet, petite little girl cat who really deserves a good home. After spending the first part of her life in a hoarding situation with 100 other cats, she was in need of some TLC. With a little love, attention and time, she has become a sweet, playful kitty who loves humans. She really enjoys being pet and will give little "nose kisses" when she wants your attention. She can do really cool acrobatic flips and leaps when she plays with her favorite toy, which is a catnip filled mouse attached to a string. She almost always wants to play, and will walk over to her toy and put her paw on it while making little tiny meows that sound like a kitten. She uses the litterbox faithfully and isn't picky about food or treats. She doesn't shed much, and has a nice, loud purr that she uses often. She just wants to be loved! Blaine is currently living comfortably in her foster mom's basement, but after her friend Quinn was adopted she has started to get lonely. She loves other cats, calm dogs, and friendly people. Can you give this little furry treasure, who wouldn't be with us today  unless Ruff Start hadn't saved her from the euthanization at the shelter, the home she deserves?  

If you are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org. An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.

Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals!

All Ruff Start dogs and cats are spayed/neutered, up to date on age appropriate vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm prevention (dogs) as well as heartworm tested (dogs).

Ruff Start Rescue is a foster based rescue. Animals are located in homes throughout Minnesota. We do not have a facility where animals are kept.

name: Tuna
description:
Name: Tuna
DOB: 1 year old
Weight: 8 lbs
Adoption Fee: $75 in the month of April

Hi, my name is Tuna. I am a total sweetheart and I love to be pet. In fact, if you stop petting me I will come up to you and ask to be pet some more. I am a little mischievous though, and like to find sneaky spots to hide. I like to play with toys and love to hang out with my humans. I am good with other cats, and will mostly ignore dogs if they don't try to chase me or come up to me. Although I love to play, I can be a little rough so a home with no or older kids would be best for me.

My foster sister Babs and I came to the rescue together from a not so great situation and so we are very bonded. She is the other kitty in my photos. We are very close and would like to be adopted together if possible. She is shy, but I help her come out of her shell!

My sister Babs' profile is here: http://www.ruffstartrescue.org/animals/detail?AnimalID=12171914

If you are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org. An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.

name: Babs
description:
Name: Babs
DOB: 1 year old
Weight: 6 lbs
Adoption Fee: $75 in the month of April

Hi! My name is Babs. I am a very sweet kitty, but I am very shy and slow to show my personality. I came from a not so great situation, so it is taking me some time to learn to trust people again. My foster mom just comes into my room to talk to me and wait for me to come up to her, because I like to approach her on my own terms. I let her pet my head sometimes and am warming up to her. I wasn't treated very good by people before, but I am learning that all people aren't bad and I think I will be a very loving cat someday with time and patience. I am curious about toys, but I don't quite know what to do with them yet. 

I am very close with my foster brother, Tuna. We came to the rescue together and are very bonded. I love to lay by him and give him a bath. I'd like to go to a home that could adopt us together and give me time to come out of my shell.

My brother Tuna's profile can be viewed here: http://www.ruffstartrescue.org/animals/detail?AnimalID=12171555#prettyPhoto

descriptionPlain:
Name: Babs
 DOB: 1 year old
 Weight: 6 lbs
 Adoption Fee: $75 in the month of April

 Hi! My name is Babs. I am a very sweet kitty, but I am very shy and slow to show my personality. I came from a not so great situation, so it is taking me some time to learn to trust people again. My foster mom just comes into my room to talk to me and wait for me to come up to her, because I like to approach her on my own terms. I let her pet my head sometimes and am warming up to her. I wasn't treated very good by people before, but I am learning that all people aren't bad and I think I will be a very loving cat someday with time and patience. I am curious about toys, but I don't quite know what to do with them yet. 

 I am very close with my foster brother, Tuna. We came to the rescue together and are very bonded. I love to lay by him and give him a bath. I'd like to go to a home that could adopt us together and give me time to come out of my shell.

 My brother Tuna's profile can be viewed here: http://www.ruffstartrescue.org/animals/detail?AnimalID=12171555#prettyPhoto

 If you are interested in me, please fill out an adoption application at www.ruffstartrescue.org. An adoption application is the best way to show your interest in an animal. Once we receive your application, a placement coordinator will be in contact with you as soon as possible.
 
 Please check out our website, www.ruffstartrescue.org for more details and additional pictures on any of our animals!

 All Ruff Start dogs and cats are spayed/neutered, up to date on age appropriate vaccines, microchipped, dewormed, and on monthly flea/tick and heartworm prevention (dogs) as well as heartworm tested (dogs).

 Ruff Start Rescue is a foster based rescue. Animals are located in homes throughout Minnesota. We do not have a facility where animals are kept.

 Ruff Start Rescue Adoption Policies: http://www.ruffstartrescue.org/info/display?PageID=11744

name: Elos
breed: Domestic Long Hair / Tuxedo / Mixed (long coat)
description: Elos is an owner surrender. His family was heartbroken,but they were thinking of Elos.  He was with them for 6 months and their other cat never accepted him and terrorized him. Elos is a big, fluffy, lump of timid kitty.  He is very laid back and prefers women to men.  He is probably better off being an "only child."  He is cuddly,playful, and affectionate.  Elos is neutered, vaccinated, microchipped, and felv fiv heartworm negative.  His adoption fee is $100.

She required a lot of TLC and there were times we weren't sure she was going to make it but she did. Now she is a normal rambunctious little kitten. Please consider giving her a furrever home!

name: Dove
description: Dove is a 3yr old puppy at heart with a lot of awesome training under her belt. She was brought in as an epileptic alert service dog and went through six months of work towards becoming certified. She's fully crate trained, knows many commands, leash trained, fantastic with children of all ages, loving, and an absolute champ at cuddling. Dove does need to be an only dog, however. She was the victim of some pretty serious abuse when she was a puppy and now sees other dogs as a threat to her life. She needs to be in a home where she can love and play and be the wonderful girl we know her to be without having to fear that she'll be attacked by other animals. Dove would do so well as a family girl, or a hiking companion, or a fellow couch potato (she loves watching baseball games). She would fit in any place that can allow her to be the only pet. Please contact us at 520-977-8000 or 520-406-7533 or fill out an adoption applications at smilingdogrescue.com

name: BeBe
description:
Meet BeBe! BeBe is about 2 years old. BeBe is a sweet girl who loves going for runs in our play yard. BeBe is very shy and needs time to warm up to you. BeBe would do well in a home with no young children because she is so timid. If you would like to make BeBe a part of your family, fill out an application at www.barktownrescue.org.

BEBE'S ADOPTION FEE IS $150. 

 


The shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at the dog's predominant breed or breed mix. We strongly encourage you to select your new pet by looking at each dog's individual personality and pet qualities rather than relying on a breed label that is only our best guess. 

 

Our adoption fees vary from $150 and up.  All of our dogs are up to date on vaccines, heart worm preventives, and flea/tick medication, and will be spayed/neutered prior to adoption. Portions of your adoption fee also help care for the sick and injured animals that we take in.  Thank you for supporting us and considering a rescue dog!

name: Lazarus
description: Lazarus is a sweet and handsome boy!  He was found as a stray and is positive for FIV.  This is not contagious to dogs or people and he can still live a perfectly normal life as a family pet.  It's only contagious to other cats via deep bite wounds so it is safe to have him as part of a multi-cat household.

name: PERRO
SCOUT
Elliot
description:
Please go to our website www.secondchancedogrescue.org to complete an application.

We will make every attempt to process all applications  within 3 business days of receipt


Meet Elliot! Elliot is a sweet and gentle 8 year old, 11 lb Bichon mix.  Elliot is very loving and becomes attached  quickly to his caretaker.  He came from a home with 4 other dogs when the owner became too ill to care for them all.  He is house trained and gets along great with other dogs & cats.  He loves attention from people and would do fine as an only dog or ease right in to an existing pack.  Elliot is a sweet lap dog and also enjoys going out for walks & is very easy to handle.  Elliot just had a dental and got a fresh groom.  He is neutered, microchipped and current on vaccines.  Elliot has severe flea allergies and is currently responding well to an oral flea treatment- Bravecto.  His adopter would need to maintain this quarterly flea preventative.   Please go to Second Chance Dog Rescue's website at: http://secondchancedogrescue.org/adopt-a-dog/adoption-application/  to complete an application to meet him.  Elliot's adoption fee is $250.00 which helps the rescue cover spay/neuter costs, vaccinations, medical treatments, food and supplies.


All of our dogs are in private volunteer foster homes, and as such these individuals are most qualified to answer any questions regarding the dog.

We do not have a central shelter or kennel locations - you must make a private one-on-one meet and greet appointment with each individual dog at the foster family's convenience.  To protect our foster families' privacy, we must have an APPROVED adoption application on file before we release their contact information.

All of our dogs are fixed (spayed/neutered) and up to date on shots. We have a 2 week foster-to-adopt period to make sure the dog is a fit for your family. Adoption fees vary from dog-to-dog.  

Please note that an approved application DOES NOT guarantee that the dog will be placed with you. The final decision rests with our fosters as they know the dogs the best, and please be aware that there may be other applicants interested in the same dog. We continue accepting applications on a dog until the dog is with the new adoptive family in their home.

Thank you for visiting our dogs located at www.SecondChanceDogRescue.org

name: Buddy - Sweetest Beagle Mix
description:
Meet precious Buddy! Buddy is a very sweet senior beagle mix with a precious underbite.  He’s a neat and happy and quiet boy. 

 

He is 11, doing just great, affectionate and happy. He is in pretty good health and loves to hang out with his people and take walks. He is good with dogs and cats. Such a sweet boy, who has some more years of loving to offer.  

 

He is very good about using the doggy door, is super delighted when you come home or walk in the room and enjoys doing his happy dance.    

He is great on a leash. 

 

He has a little bit of hearing loss, but is smart and knows hand signals.  He’s a neat and polite eater, and loves to sleep on the bed and go on car trips! 

 

This cutie pie is updated on all shots, neutered and his adopt fee is $125.

 

Puget Sound area.


We cover the medical to prepare the pet for adoption and the adopt donations go directly to cover those costs and range from $295-$495.  Thank you for stepping up to save a life!

To expedite to meet with this dog, please go to our site at www.savinggreatanimals.org and fill out an application. We look at the first applications to arrive, so we hope to hear from you soon!

COSMO, PLEASE NOTE that you can adopt ANY DOG on our website REGARDLESS of location, please call Janet first, 479-216-6044 to make that he is still available, is a  not a typical puppy that is sweet, gentle, and fun, fun, fun!  He is a one dog show, very entertaining, everybody is his best friend, he loves to sleep in your lap and he is such a good boy!  He has an underbite.  We hear that he may be from another galaxy!  I can send a video.  This baby is about 16 weeks old and weighs about 13#. This baby is nothing but a precious doll! The baby will come spayed or neutered, at least two puppy shots, Bordetella, Rabies, if old enough, wormed and fecal tested and a vet's exam.  The adoption fee is $250.00, transport fee is $140.00.  Please call me BEFORE sending in an application.  I also send you my two vet references.  We take small dogs and puppies from 4 kill animal controls.  We can not adopt to MA or RI.  Please call me first to make sure that she is available, Janet 479-216-6044.

WE LIVE BY FAITH AND SEE DIVINE INTERVENTION.


 
PLEASE visit our web site www.homelesspetslifeline.com  or www.dogtiredranch.com    for information about us and our Homeless Pets.
 
Getting your Dog . We use a licensed transport company to bring our dogs to New England. Sometimes adoptions are done long-distance basis and the dog goes from a foster home to the New Northern home.  Please help these dogs find their forever home!

 COSMO, PLEASE NOTE that you can adopt ANY DOG on our website REGARDLESS of location, please call Janet first, 479-216-6044 to make that he is still available, is a not a typical puppy that is sweet, gentle, and fun, fun, fun! He is a one dog show, very entertaining, everybody is his best friend, he loves to sleep in your lap and he is such a good boy! He has an underbite. We hear that he may be from another galaxy! I can send a video. This baby is about 16 weeks old and weighs about 13#. This baby is nothing but a precious doll! The baby will come spayed or neutered, at least two puppy shots, Bordetella, Rabies, if old enough, wormed and fecal tested and a vet's exam. The adoption fee is $250.00, transport fee is $140.00. Please call me BEFORE sending in an application. I also send you my two vet references. We take small dogs and puppies from 4 kill animal controls. We can not adopt to MA or RI. Please call me first to make sure that she is available, Janet 479-216-6044.

 WE LIVE BY FAITH AND SEE DIVINE INTERVENTION.




 

 PLEASE visit our web site  www.homelesspetslifeline.com  or www.dogtiredranch.com    for information about us and our Homeless Pets.

   Getting your Dog . We use a licensed transport company to bring our dogs to New England. Sometimes adoptions are done long-distance basis and the dog goes from a foster home to the New Northern home. Please help these dogs find their forever home!

name: Carol
description:
If you are interested in adopting this dog, please download and complete an Adoption Questionnaire: http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/s/2016applicationdocx-1.docx and email Alex at alexandral@k-9lifesavers.org with any questions! 

You can also find the adoption questionnaire and learn about the adoption process by visiting our website: http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/howtoadopt/

Dog's Name:  Carol

Estimated Breed :  terrier/plott hound mix

Approximate Age:  1 yr

Approximate Weight:  45 lbs

Currently Living at:  Boarding 

Adoption Fee:  $300


DOG'S DESCRIPTION

Carol was adopted from us as a puppy but sadly her family couldn't handle her being a typical rambunctious and energetic pup and returned her to us. She has been confused and scared since she came back to us and she doesn't understand what she has done wrong. We are hoping that this girl gets a second chance and this time it will be forever.  She's a very sweet girl and good with other dogs.  She gets VERY excited for attention and will jump on you.  She has had some obedience training and knows SIT, but the rest still needs work. She needs a very strong handler that can work with her and give her lots of EXERCISE!  She needs to get out on run and be able to be  puppy, but also needs to continue training. She is sweet, well crate trained, housetrained (but being in a kennel sometimes undoes that hard work so a refresher course may be required).

Your new pet will require a refresher in house-training. K-9 Lifesavers strongly recommends all new adopters enroll their new pet into obedience training. This provides for an easier transition into a new home, ensures the dog remains well socialized, and helps form a bond between the dog and the new family.           

Adoption fees cover basic vetting, spay/neuter surgery (for dogs over 6 months old), rabies, distemper/parvo vaccinations, treatment for worms, heartworm testing, monthly heartworm prevention and monthly flea/tick prevention (while the animal is in our care), and transport costs from high-kill shelter. Please note that on average, K-9 Lifesavers spend significantly more on each dog than their adoption fee. Adoption fee for HW positive dog also covers heartworm treatment at our partner vets. 

Foster Program:  Foster homes provide for the temporary care of a rescue until the dog is placed into a loving, forever home.  For more information on becoming a foster parent, and our Foster Program, visit http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/foster/ or email our Foster Coordinator at foster@k-9lifesavers.org

Help Save Lives!  Make a tax-deductible donation today by clicking on the Donate Button below! Donations help us offset boarding costs and additional medical treatment for those dogs who need it.  K-9 Lifesavers receives NO federal funding and we are non-profit, all-volunteer run rescue. ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE. 

For more information on K-9 Lifesavers, or to view a complete listing of all our Adoptable Dogs, visit our website at www.k-9lifesavers.org.

Please “like” our Facebook Page for the most current events and new dogs.

Thank you for considering a rescue dog!

 

SPONSOR ME!

Please donate towards my care and medical expenses here: http://www.k-9lifesavers.org/donate/
